body:
@vorburger I did as you said and notice that were about 862 warning with about 102 I have turned to errors in previous PRs(made checks as errors). 
I will suggest I perform this update instead of renovate-bot since it needs some modifications in addition to changing the version and it will preferable to add those additional checks in smaller PRs.
@percyashu Resolve conflict, again (sorry)
@awasum , will do!
FINERACT-1022 says this may be broken, and we thus may revert this again.
I'll rebase and undraft this one after having re-reviewed #1049 ...

> The question now becomes when exactly we want to merge this
>  I'll post something to the dev list ASAP.

As per email thread "Massive Fineract automated code reformatting (FINERACT-1006)", I'm going to do this in the coming hours. I'll attempt to merge any open passing PRs BEFORE doing the bulk reformat. FYI @thesmallstar @ptuomola @awasum @xurror @percyashu 

> should I add more formatting tags in the XML? 

Please don't touch it anymore now, and put follow-up in future new PRs after merge.
@nikpawar89 OK for you if we merge this now? Just double checking, given your previous review (above).

FTR #943 will not reformat this `fineract-provider/src/main/resources/static/api-docs/apiLive.htm` so we don't have to wait from either one on the other to avoid merge conflicts... I'll go ahead with #943 later today, and this can be separately merged any time later.
@rarkins it worked! Neat... Thank you.

Actually the merge conflict here was due to #1020 and trivial to resolve - I have, for once, just used GitHub's Web UI ... if I didn't screw it up, hopefully this will pass the build and I'll merge it.

@nnatarajan would you be willing to resolve the merge conflicts which now appear here? Thanks! (It's just due to us having meanwhile merged other PRs; this sometimes happens when we work in parallel, and is somewhat unavoidable.)
@vorburger not fully yet. Will request a review from @ptuomola when complete

Whoa! Nice. Another very real bug in Fineract caught by Error Prone!

https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/JodaPlusMinusLong

https://www.joda.org/joda-time/apidocs/org/joda/time/DateTime.html#plus-long-

FYI @ptuomola @awasum @thesmallstar @xurror

>  I will suggest I perform this update instead of renovate-bot since it needs some modifications in addition to changing the version and it will preferable to add those additional checks in smaller PRs.

Sounds like a great plan to me, please go ahead! But let's keep this PR open just as a reminder to do that, please. Whenever we have a new (better) PR from you, then we'll "duplicate" this.
@percyashu this will need a rebase and conflict resolution, but perhaps it's best if you wait with doing that until I'm done with #943 which I'm doing soon (today), and pick this up tomorrow.

@ptuomola was wondering if you would like to help code-review this PR as well? Just because it's this is very similar & seems related to #1006 on which you have engaged. If interested, then I or @awasum would merge this only after your LGTM.
/rebase

Wait a second - this disabled all tests!!!!! :sob: 

Both `./gradlew test` and `./gradlew integrationTest` don't do anything, anymore after I merge this.

We therefore either have to revert this ASAP, or fix it today... sorry & thanks for understanding.

The Revert is non-trivial because I've meanwhile merged other PRs.

@xurror @percyashu @thesmallstar @awasum @ptuomola would one of you like to look into how to make tests run? I'm guessing the Gradle needs some sort of configuration change to run JUnit 5...

This is now blocking #943 ... :disappointed:

LGM,  @vorburger whenever you have time please merge this PR.  Thanks!
@rrpawar96  good work!

This will fail with 14 integration test failures... :cry:  @xurror I doubt you actually ran all tests in #1020.

The failures seems to be due to some parameter order mix up - I'm checking if I can easily fix them myself quickly. If not, I'll (have to..) sink more team into figuring out how to fully revert #1020 cleanly instead (PITA, just fixing is likely faster).
@thesmallstar check this out... Renovate Bot is quick to catch up to your work! :smiley:

@vorburger 

How frustrating! Both checks passed on GitHub yesterday, earning xurror ok.

I was concerned that this would not get merged in time.

It seems with all the bulk changes today have resulted in merge conflicts, which will continue until completed.

Please let me know when the bulk changes are complete, then it will make sense to redo the 500 changes on my end.

I am hoping that I can revisit and resolve this tomorrow.
Bulk changes for mass reformatting are now fully completed.

> This will fail with 14 integration test failures...  @xurror I doubt you actually ran all tests in #1020.
> 
> The failures seems to be due to some parameter order mix up - I'm checking if I can easily fix them myself quickly. If not, I'll (have to..) sink more team into figuring out how to fully revert #1020 cleanly instead (PITA, just fixing is likely faster).

I ran the tests, some must have excaped my vigilence. Thanks for your followup.
@vorburger This should fix Spotless with Eclipse

Regarding change in our formatter-xml, checkstyle and formatter xml did not agree on whether to add space after Generic token (" > " ), I have enforced the formatter to follow checkstyle and I think that is expected to be done in rest of he PRs.
For your reference, @vorburger @ptuomola  https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_whitespace.html#GenericWhitespace
@vorburger , resolved the merge conflicts.
RightCurly checkstyle will follow this, it was probably possible to add it in this one. I sticked to the rule of one checkstyle per PR.
@vorburger I personally (slightly) prefer the no-whitespace option, so looks good to me!
@thesmallstar resolve conflict
Automatically done by spotless
@ptuomola looks like@percyashu would like this to be re-reviewed.

Whoa! @ptuomola FYI @thesmallstar was going to look into Swagger after completing Checkstyle (and SQL security), but I'm sure he doesn't mind this start.. we have, more than, enough to do on this project for everyone! 

I'll have a closer look at this myself also some time in the coming days.

@vorburger @thesmallstar Not to worry - there's still plenty to do on Swagger! I just did the basics: upgrading & fixed Swagger UI and added the Gradle task to create the JSON. 

All the rest of the tasks still remain, i.e.
- Getting the rest of the information into the generated JSON file
- Improving layout / navigation of Swagger
- Getting "Try me" button to work
- Autogenerating client library
etc etc...
@ptuomola I really appreciate this work, I want to wrap SQL security and Swagger quickly (and nicely) so I can look into more functional issues at Fineract, and this would really help :D
@vorburger Here are some more date changes to fix timezone issues with integration tests...

@vorburger FYI - the duplicates in JAR/WAR are caused by setting the class and resource paths the same in build.gradle - which is needed to get JPA tests to work when run inside Gradle. I couldn't find another easy solution to that problem, so simply telling Gradle to exclude duplicate files when building the JAR / WAR seemed to be the easiest fix to the duplicates issue.
Not sure if this change is needed afterall. I've been using the automatic builder for a while, and haven't had any major problems with it.

@vorburger Don't you think it would be a little bit problematic to have ./setting/preferences out of git ignore? If a contributor changes his pref to what he likes, he might add that to the commit, or any small change for instance what he prefers.
Will it not be a problem in this situation? Am I missing anything?

So I had to modify the checkstyle a little bit:
I have modified from option => ALONE to ALONE_OR_SINGLELINE
Reason: 
Checkstyle would treat: 
function Xyz() {} //violation
I think @vorburger  you would agree to keep it this way rather than
function XyZ(){
}
Spotless love the first one too (With current config). Also if you are wondering that it would also allow: 
function Xyz() {  something } 
Nope, it won't, spotless would take care ;)
This is actually completely automated by spotless, but just an extra check, just in case.

This is interesting.. why do we even have those 2 separate date functions? I'm keeping this PR open and not yet merged because I'm hoping to look s little bit more closely at those dates utilities - another day (too tired).

@rarkins some Bot at Amazon seems to be releasing this library every other day or so?! While it's not much work to click Merge, it's still a bit .. following the release pace here for this particular case still seems a little excessive, to me.. is there any way to "throttle" PRs for particular libraries? One of these every other week or whatever would surely be sufficient - and reduce "noise" a bit, for this project. Is that possible to configure?
Ort perhaps we could tell it to office is only next minor (and major), so 1.12.x and 2.x, but not every single patch (3rd version number) every other day?
@vorburger yes, you can set schedules on a per-package basis, or you could disable patch updates and take only minor or major. In some projects I update the AWS SDK only monthly, for example.
@kiran-vsm please make more contributions!! :-)
@rarkins you wouldn't happen to have an example we could copy/paste to avoid RTFM? ;-) PS: Your MTTR is incredible.

@vorburger Sorry this was just for badImport https://errorprone.info/bugpattern/BadImport.
I just added UnnecessaryStaticImport since there wasn't any violation in the code.
@vorburger check out #1076 - I think that's the simplest way to address it for now.
@ptuomola @vorburger @awasum  LGTY?
@ptuomola LGTY?
@awasum will you be doing a more detailed review of this PR? (Your GSoC student.)
@thesmallstar FYI

Thanks for this Draft. I'll have a closer look at the build failure some time in the coming week, and propose how to address it. (Work on something else in the meantime.) Note to self - see https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/blob/master/sevntu-checks/src/main/java/com/github/sevntu/checkstyle/checks/coding/AvoidHidingCauseExceptionCheck.java
Please merge  #1080 before this, it would be easier to deal with merge conflicts(if any).
Since this passes, #971 can be closed
@awasum LGTY?

I think we should leave this check disabled as it may mess with Swagger format especially when using it as a generator for API clients using something like Retrofit. I had an experience on another Fineract fork which when the names of classes are not very descriptive to the last details, one may get confused using these Swagger classes as a generator. I dont know if you understand me? @vorburger  FYI. In addition, this is not a major problem.

> Wait a second, I've only properly reviewed this now.. are we saying that we are forbidding import static with this? That seems weird- import static are nice and useful, no? Or is this preventing some corner case that I'm not getting yet?

@vorburger , Looks like other static imports still work on the code base. Also seem @percyashu  just refactored static import which could make the code difficult to read. I dont know if this will make you to change your mind?
@percyashu  Address last set of feedback here and maybe @ptuomola will give it a LGTH
@vorburger merge this when you can. Or maybe you want to take another quick look to make sure am not missing something. @ptuomola @xurror @thesmallstar  take a look.

> I think we should leave this check disabled as it may mess with Swagger format especially when using it as a generator for API clients using something like Retrofit. I had an experience on another Fineract fork which when the names of classes are not very descriptive to the last details, one may get confused using these Swagger classes as a generator. I dont know if you understand me? @vorburger FYI. In addition, this is not a major problem.

@percyashu did you want to do this?
@thesmallstar do you want to look into why this is failing?
@thesmallstar just wanted to check if you'd still like to write an IT for this, or if we should just merge it as is? Please don't hesitate to ask if you need help with the IT.

This looks suspicious. It failed to "compileJava" due to badImport error-prone check.
@percyashu maybe you can tell better?
Probably #1053 related? Proposal because I just merged several PRs without rebasing each of them.. develop may be broken? Please raise PR to fix - hopefully trivial?
@ptuomola do you have any input/view re. this and Swagger? (Given your Swagger related PR, which BTW I'll review tomorrow.)

@vorburger yes, I did not find any integrations tests for the audit section. Makes this harder and I am trying to figure out on this. 
I am not sure about the work-flow in this case, and I couldn't figure out much by looking at other integration tests. 
If you can address the following doubts(if they are too naive, I would research more)
1. Should I also be worried about tests for creating new audits?(since there are none now)
2. If not, what will be the basic logic of the test: I thought it would be just to visit the route and check if we get a success message. 
I am confused about what purpose does the integration test will play in this case, is it just point 2? 
Also if I were to create integration tests for creation will the workflow be:
  -  post request to create an audit 
  -  Get request to check if it stored in the server. 

I hope I am making some sense :P
@nnatarajan  you have spotless violations in your code in the files you didn't change. I am not sure what's going on, but maybe you can run ./gradlew spotlessApply and rebase this?
This should not fail due to "Spotless" once #1091 is merged (and this branch is rebased).
@thesmallstar , thank you for letting me know.
Error-prone needs a fix, looking into it.
@thesmallstar, I appreciate your help. I ran ./gradlew spotlessApply, which did update five files. I will wait for 1091 merge.
@thesmallstar I think if you fix the current 1 problem, the compileIntegrationTest may yield no violation.
@percyashu yes :) Let's see what Travis says now.
This pull request seems to be stale.  Are you still planning to work on it?  We will automatically close it in 30 days.
LGTM
@vorburger there is a option to rebase this PR in description, should we do that?
@thesmallstar yes, please click that Checkbox (if you can, or if it's not clickable for you, then it works only for commiters; and I'll do it later, as I'm currently on Mobile where I cannot)

@percyashu @ptuomola  I was trying to add a checkstyle, that makes it necessary to use default in switch. From the discussion above, error-prone handles this in a much more intelligent way. Do you think the same? If yes, @vorburger will it be a better idea to remove that checkstyle and mention in comment about how we are handling missing defaults.

> Created PR #1045, but I do not have the option to close this one.

#1045 was meanwhile closed without conclusion, so let's keep this open until we can fix this.

There are several issues here - @nnatarajan in #1045 figured out that apparently we need to exclude `javax.validation`. After that, you run into some FasterXML Jackson related version conflict. Using `./gradlew dependencies` and doing some “before & after” comparison, and attempt to add an “exclude” to Gradle for the wrong version can probably fix this...

@percyashu @xurror do you have any interest in picking this up some time?
/rebase
/rebase

> Not sure if this change is needed afterall. I've been using the automatic builder for a while, and haven't had any major problems with it.

@ptuomola agreed, it seems to actually work not so bad for me as well, now. Do you want to just close this PR then?
@ptuomola @thesmallstar OK for you to already upgrade this now?

> I'll have a closer look at the build failure some time in the coming week, and propose how to 

So most of this seems to be related to Fineract's concept of having its own "business" exceptions (like `RoleNotFoundException` and all those other many subclasses of `AbstractPlatformResourceNotFoundException`), and their constructors not accepting any `Throwable cause` argument.

If we do want to introduce this quality check (which I think we should, in order to prevent wrong exception handling for OTHER types of exception than those mentioned above), then I think the easiest way, and most "consistent", would be to simple have even those "business" exceptions accept a `cause` (unrelated to whether they really "need" it or not; I don't really see any "harm"). @ptuomola does this sound reasonable to you?
@vorburger , it seems that both checks passed with rebase. Please let me know if I should investigate CORS further. I don't mind if this is a concern.

@thesmallstar so these audits are not something you can create new audits of, you cannot really post a request to create an audit. They are basically just traces of changes made - read https://demo.fineract.dev/fineract-provider/api-docs/apiLive.htm#audits and then check out https://demo.fineract.dev/fineract-provider/api/v1/audits?tenantIdentifier=default (login with _mifos/password_) ... does that help? So an IT for this I guess would make 2-3 POSTs on a few other entities (perhaps create like a User, or whatever), and then do a GET with a sort and make sure that works.

But let me already merge this as-is anyway so we can progress and close FINERACT-799, and you can contribute an integration test in a separate follow-up PR. Fixed bugs without ITs are better than not fixed bugs!
/rebase
@thesmallstar but this actually needs a rebase and a `./gradlew :spotlessApply` now...
@vorburger sounds good to me!

> But let me already merge this as-is anyway so we can progress and close FINERACT-799, and you can contribute an integration test in a separate follow-up PR. Fixed bugs without ITs are better than not fixed bugs!

@vorburger  Yes please merge this, I will create a JIRA issue so that we can keep track of this integration test.
@ptuomola does this one have LGTM from you now?
